heaviest_rainfall.status: Record-breaking rain fell on 04 January 2025 with a total accumulation of 36.8mm over 37.2 hours and falling at a rate of 4.6mm per hour at times.

heaviest_rainrate.status: The rain rate reached 27.0mm per hour on 02 September 2025, and resulted in 21.19mm of rain over 15.0 hours.  This is the highest rate recorded by our weather station.

longest_rain.status: The record duration for continuous rain was set on 04 January 2025, the storm lasted 37.2 hours with a total precipitation of 36.8mm and it reached 4.6mm per hour at times.

most_lightning.status: The most lightning strikes in one day since 11 April 2025 is 23 and it happened on 07 September 2025.

nearest_lightning.status: The nearest lightning strike ever noted was on 13 May 2025, at 4.97 miles distance.

storm.status: There is a storm in the vicinity.  This is the first storm since 20 September 2025.

top_10_dry.status: The longest dry period started on 24 April 2025 and lasted for 19 days.

top_10_rainy.status: The longest rainy period started on 30 November 2024 and lasted for 10 days.

cold_snaps.status: There is not a cold snap right now.  There have been 6 this year, compared to a usual average of 3.7.

extreme.status: The highest recorded temperature difference is 26.7°C from 29 April 2025 (when the temperature reached 27.1°C but fell to 0.4°C).

heatwaves.status: There is currently no heatwaves.  This year there have been 6 heatwavess, usually there are 1.9 heatwavess per year.

tropical.status: The last tropical night was 18 July 2025, there have been only 62 tropical nights since 1973.

average.status: The current average daily wind direction is southerly (189°).  In the UK, a southerly wind usually brings milder, moist air from the Atlantic.

gusts.status: The highest wind gust ever seen is 93.7 mph on 13 October 2012.

run.status: The record wind run remains at 1737 miles from 21 October 2012.

speed.status: To date, the maximum wind speed recorded is 93.7 mph on 13 October 2012.

top_10_windy.status: The longest windy period started on 11 October 2012 and lasted for 21 days.

summary.description:
Today, cooler for the feels like temperature (down 7.6°C) and outside temperature (down 5.5°C) and drier conditions in outside humidity (down 7%), inside humidity (down 5%), and rainfall (down 0.1 mm).

The past week and month had observable variation in feels like temperature (up 7.8°C), dew point temperature (up 6.5°C), outside temperature (up 5.3°C), and cloud levels (down 207 m) when compared to today.

cloud levels.description:
Today’s average cloud levels is 598.8m higher than yesterday, 631.5m higher than the past week, 206.8m higher than the past month.

Yesterday, cloud levels hit a low of 841m and a high of 1909m, averaging 2060m; the past week and month reported somewhat higher averages.
cloud levels.summary: The sky’s high clouds will permit plenty of sunshine.

The dew point temperatures yesterday fell between 8.2°C minimum and 15.5°C maximum, with an average of 6.4°C; weekly and monthly averages were marginally higher at 13.0°C and 12.0°C.

summary.summary: Inside; comfortable and pleasant temperatures. Outside; mild temperatures are expected. Also, dry and less humid conditions and very little to no wind will be present. Possible light showers, the sky’s high clouds will permit plenty of sunshine, and moderate levels of sunlight will be present. Weather patterns to stay the same.
